values: Greenhouse gases
GHGs are prescribed from annual concentration timeseries.
Y: Prescribed concentrations, distributions or time series data
CO2 concentrations follow the RCP scenarios (Meinshausen et al., 2011; doi:10.1007/s10584-011-0156-z), and are interpolated from one year to the next.
Y: Prescribed concentrations, distributions or time series data
CH4 concentrations follow the RCP scenarios (Meinshausen et al., 2011; doi:10.1007/s10584-011-0156-z), and are interpolated from one year to the next.
Y: Prescribed concentrations, distributions or time series data
N2O concentrations follow the RCP scenarios (Meinshausen et al., 2011; doi:10.1007/s10584-011-0156-z), and are interpolated from one year to the next.
C: Fixed prescribed climatology of concentrations with no year-to-year variability
C: Fixed prescribed climatology of concentrations with no year-to-year variability
Y: Prescribed concentrations, distributions or time series data
Option 1: CFCs, including CFC-12, are provided as actual concentrations
CFC-11 & CFC-12 concentrations follow the RCP scenarios, and are interpolated from one year to the next.
C: Fixed prescribed climatology of concentrations with no year-to-year variability

Climatological concentrations. Taken from ECHAM5, following Tanre, D., Geleyn, J.-F. and Slingo, J. M. (1984): First results of the introduction of an advanced aerosol-radiation interaction in the ecmwf low resolution global model. In: Aerosols and Their Climatic  effects, edited by Gerber, H. and Deepak, A., pp. 133–177. A. Deepak,
Hampton, Va.

Regional Atmospheric Climate Model
HIRHAM4

Changes from version 4 to version 5 included upgrades to both the dynamical core with an upgrade from an older HIRLAM version to version 7.0 and to the physical parameterization going from ECHAM4 to ECHAM5.
GCM-based
Normally one year of spinup is included in an experiment. All soil water reservoirs are initialized as full.
No nudging
Internally at DMI (restricted access)
Fortran, csh
HIRHAM5
HIRHAM, CORDEX, HIRHAM5, DMI

HIRHAM5 has been developed at the DMI. It is a merge of the hydrostatic dynamical core of the HIRLAM 7.0 NWP model and the physical parameterization of the ECHAM5 GCM version 5.2.02. Most model development has dealt with parameterizations relevant to the Arctic or technical issues.
